title: Killer Pilot Greg Lynn's Dark Past Revealed | 10 News+
description: Greg Lynn is a former Jetstar pilot who murdered camper Carol Clay in Victoria's high country. Tonight, a court suppression has been lifted, meaning now 10 News+ can tell you he also had a violent past. His first wife, Lisa, died in mysterious circumstances more than 25 years ago. title: Jared Kushner And Steve Witkoff Meet With Putin To Discuss Ukraine Peace Plan | 10 News+
description: Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner and envoy Steve Witkoff met with Putin in Moscow to discuss peace plans for the Russia-Ukraine war. Meanwhile, Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is travelling across Europe, from France to Ireland, as Australia considers sending military helicopters the war-torn country. title: Donald Trump Says He Will Void All Joe Biden Pardons Signed With An Autopen | 10 News+
description: US President Donald Trump says he will void pardons Joe Biden signed using an autopen. title: Sabrina Carpenter Slams Trump, Rafah Crossing To Open, Popular Food Makers Sued | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – Sabrina Carpenter has criticised the White House for using her song ‘Juno’ in a video that showed law enforcement arresting people as Pete Hegseth denies the administration has committed a war crime. Israel has announced the Rafah crossing will open in the coming days, a landmark lawsuit against the creators of ultra-processed foods has compared their tactics to the tobacco industry, the search for missing flight MH370 will resume and the drunken raccoon who had a rough night out. title: Mother Pleas For Meningococcal Vaccine To Be Made Free In Victoria | 10 News+
description: A Melbourne mother whose son died in September after contracting Meningococcal B has today delivered a petition to the Victorian parliament. She is calling for the vaccine to be free in Victoria, as it is in South Australia, Queensland and the Northern Territory. title: Kiwi Reporter Hit In The Face By Seagull | 10 News
description: A Māori Television reporter has been struck in the face by a seagull while filming a news piece in Auckland’s CBD.  Jessica Tyson - a former Miss World New Zealand - was recording a piece to camera in strong winds when the bird hit her at speed.  She later shared a photo of her injuries, saying she’s “fine” despite a cut above her eye that’s left a small scar.  The clip has since gone viral, with viewers flooding social media to wish the reporter well. title: Israel Plans To Open Rafah Crossing To Allow Gazans Into Egypt | 10 News
description: Israel has announced the Rafah crossing will open in the coming days allowing Gazans to cross into Egypt, but Palestinians will not be able to return to Gaza until the last hostage remains are returned.  The reopening of the crossing was part of the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas, but Benjamin Netanyahu had previously resisted opening up the border with Egypt.  The Israeli government has given the go ahead, with representatives from the European Union expected to help facilitate the crossings. title: Doctor Who Sold Matthew Perry Ketamine Sentenced To 2.5 Years Prison | 10 News
description: A California doctor has been sentenced to two-and-a-half years in prison for illegally selling ketamine to Matthew Perry in the weeks before the actor’s fatal overdose.  Judge Sherilyn Peace Garnett said Dr Salvador Plasencia “exploited” Perry’s addiction, though he didn’t provide the dose that killed him.  He is the first of five people sentenced over the 2023 death, with Perry’s family delivering emotional statements in court.  Plasencia tearfully apologised in court, admitting he took advantage of the actor while knowing he was a struggling addict. title: Food Giants Sued Over Ultra Processed Products | 10 News
description: Ten major food brands including Kraft Heinz, Nestlé, and Coca-Cola are being sued in the US over their ultra processed foods, with officials claiming their tactics resemble the tobacco industry.  The city of San Francisco has filed a first of its kind lawsuit against the corporate giants, accusing them of selling foods that they knew were harmful to public health, and were designed to be addictive.  10’s Late News explains. title: Drunk Racoon Passes Out In Virginia Bottle Shop | 10 News
description: On Saturday morning, an employee at a Virginia bottle shop arrived to find smashed bottles, a collapsed ceiling tile and alcohol pooled across the floor.  The culprit turned out to be a surprising intruder — a mischievous raccoon who ended up having a little too much to drink.
